snippet: Two senior leaders of the Khmer Rouge, which brutalized Cambodia in the 1970s, were found guilty of crimes against humanity, in the first convictions of members of the regime’s leadership.
abstract: Cambodian court finds Nuon Chea and Khieu Samphan, two most senior surviving leaders of Khmer Rouge, which brutalized Cambodia during 1970s, guilty of crimes against humanity and sentences them to life in prison; more than 1.7 million people died under Khmer Rouge rule from 1975 to 1979.

byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and JULIA WALLACE

lead_paragraph: Two senior leaders of the Khmer Rouge, which brutalized Cambodia in the 1970s, were found guilty of crimes against humanity, in the first convictions of members of the regime’s leadership.

headline.main: 2 Khmer Rouge Leaders Are Convicted in Cambodia
headline.print_headline: 2 Khmer Rouge Leaders Are Convicted in Cambodia

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
